properties.name: Bristol International Comic Expo Film Night 2008
properties.description: Posted by MarclougeeBristol, United KingdomOrang Utan Comics are proud to present the official Bristol International Comic Expo Film Night 2008. Held on May 9th at 6pm at the Ramada Plaza Hotel in Bristol, this year\'s Film Night will be bigger and better than ever. So far we are pleased to announce the - first ever \'Ray Harryhausen Presents\' production; the legendary visual effects creator, animator and producer presents The Pit And The Pendulum, a stock motion animated short based on the Edgar Alan Poe classic. There will be a collection during the evening for charity in aid of the Orangutan Foundation UK. There will be a bar at the rear of the auditorium. Entry is FREE, and the first 100 people through the door on the night will also receive a Goody Bag from hosts Orang Utan Comics, sponsored by Forbidden Planet London!

properties.name: Cinema Wasteland Cinemashow, Oct. 5-7
properties.description: Posted by Marclougee 12905 York Delta Dr, Cleveland, OHCleveland, Ohio! MOVIE, MOVIES and more MOVIES! We cram in as many classic Drive-In movies, independent films and shorts as we can pack into a weekend. You’ll find movies and shorts on real 16mm film in our 200 seat “Film Room” and all kinds of indy films, shorts, and guest related features in our smaller, 100 seat “Video and DVD projection Room” all weekend long.

properties.name: H.P.Lovecraft Film Festival
properties.description: Posted by Marclougee Portland, OregonOur purpose: promote the works of H.P. Lovecraft, literary horror, & weird tales through the cinematic adaptations by professional & amateur filmmakers. The festival was founded in 1995 by Andrew Migliore in the hope that H.P. Lovecraft would be rightly recognized as a master of gothic horror and his work more faithfully adapted to film & television. —founder Andrew Migliore

properties.name: Kosmopolis
properties.description: Posted by Marclougee Barcelona, SpainThe Pit and the Pendulum short film is featured at Kosmopolis in 2008, as the event seeks to connects literature & it\'s readers/ viewers in new & different ways, from traditional methods to digital technologies as a means of media delivery.

properties.name: Kosmopolis Film & Literature Festival, Oct. 2008
properties.description: Posted by MarclougeeBarcelona, SpainA festival of the literary in all it\'s forms, bridging media & mediums of literation. From the site: "To conceive and uphold literature as the (only?) discourse that does not seek to model a world of absolute foundations, disciplinary boundaries or ideological straitjackets." The Pit and the Pendulum will be screening at KOSMOPOLIS in October, check back the blog for more info over the next few months!

properties.name: Melbourne International Animation Festival
properties.description: Posted by MarclougeeMelbourne, AustraliaThe Pit and the Pendulum will screen in Melbourne, at the Australian Centre for the Moving Image during the festival, June 16-22, 2008. Over 2, 000 entries were submitted, and The Pit and the Pendulum is proudly an Official Selection! Here\'s a bit from the fest folks: "Get ready to strap yourselves in for a six day blast of exceptional animation from around the world in the 8th edition of the Melbourne International Animation Festival! This will be your only opportunity in Australia to see such a comprehensive line-up of current animated short films in competition and specially curated programs that highlight recent productions and absolute gems from the archive. MIAF aims to challenge and inspire audiences with thematic, aesthetic and technical diversity from award winners, outstanding industry veterans and those wonderful newcomers who are exploring their talent on screen for the very first time." See you there!

properties.name: Melbourne International Animation Festival, June 16-22, 2008
properties.description: Posted by Marclougee Melbourne, AustraliaThe Pit and the Pendulum joins the best animated films from around the world in the Festival of festivals!

properties.name: Museum of the Moving Image- HEAD TRAUMA / ARG show
properties.description: Posted by Marclougee  35th Ave. At 36th St, Astoria, NYTHE PIT AND THE PENDULUM short film screens with HEAD TRAUMA ARG Multimedia Performance, Saturday, July 14, 6:30 p.m. 2006, approximately 84 mins. New York Premiere. Directed by Lance Weiler. With DJ Chief Wreck’em and The Quivers. In this innovative and playfully unsettling interactive multimedia event, the story of a drifter who returns to his grandmother’s abandoned house is brought to life in a collision of movies, music, gaming, and theatrics. Characters emerge from the audience, the DJ provides a live soundtrack, and your mobile phone becomes a cinematic gaming device. Followed by a discussion with the filmmaker. Preceded by Ray Harryhausen Presents: The Pit and The Pendulum (2006, 7 mins., video. Directed by Marc Lougee.) This stop-motion short reinterprets Edgar Allan Poe’s classic tale. Tickets: 2 Museum members/8 non-membersc. Call 718.784.4520 to order.

properties.name: New Strand Film Festival, May 2-4, 2008
properties.description: Posted by Marclougee 111 E 3rd St., West Liberty, IA 52776The New Stand Film Festival is a trendy location to enjoy independent films in the heartland. Our restored 1910 Vaudeville theatre is the perfect place to enter your latest film projects, and for all to enjoy your winning work. With our diverse population celebrating Cinco de Mayo in the streets, we will offer you opportunities not found at other film festivals. The Pit and the Pendulum screens Saturday in the "Pull On Your Shorts" program, 10-12:00 noon

properties.name: RavenCon 2008
properties.description: Posted by Marclougee Chantilly, VAScience Fiction & Fantasy return to Richmond with RavenCon 2008, a weekend celebrating the genres of Science Fiction, Fantasy and Horror. (And as we\'re playing the Edgar Allan Poe angle, we\'re Mystery friendly, too!) Join our guests for panel discussions and workshops that can only happen at RavenCon! The Pit and the Pendulum will be screening at RavenCon 2008 over the weekend- if you\'re in town, have a watch and see what all is happening!

properties.name: Riofan Festival De Cinema Fantastico
properties.description: Posted by Marclougee Rio de Janiero, BrazilIn May 2008 Rio de Janeiro will become the meeting place for fantasy film fans and enthusiasts from all over the world. For two weeks, the I Rio de Janeiro International Fantastic Film Festival – RioFan will showcase the best in horror, sci-fi and genre cinema. The Pit and the Pendulum will be screening at RIOFAN 2008!

properties.name: Rue Morgue Festival of Fear, August 22-24, 2008
properties.description: Posted by Marclougee 222 Bremner Blvd, Toronto, ONThe Pit and the Pendulum director Marc Lougee will be on hand all weekend manning a booth where you an get your own copy of the soon to be released DVD of The Pit and the Pendulum short film, with over 1.5 hours of extra features! Marc covers the gamut of film production in\'s and out\'s, with interviews, how-to\'s, and never before seen footage of the film!

properties.name: SHARPCUTS Film and Music Festival, October, 2008
properties.description: Posted by MarclougeeGuelph, OntarioA FREE film and Music festival at the University of Guelph, Ontario, Canada, October, 2008. The Pit and the Pendulum director Marc Lougee hosts a workshop on green screen visual effects techniques over the weekend! Also screening: his ward winning film, The Pit and the Pendulum, executive produced by animation and visual effects pioneer, Ray Harryhausen! bands, films, workshops, competitions, parties! Crazy fun and interesting folks. Filmmakers on hand to discuss their films and experiences

properties.name: Sacramento Horror Film Festival, Oct. 19-21, 2007
properties.description: Posted by MarclougeeSacramento, CAThe Sacramento Horror Film Festival exists to deliver high-quality independent and popular studio-release horror films, sci-fi features and short films to the horror movie fan. We promote the genres of horror and science-fiction within the Sacramento art community by hosting semi-annual art shows, projectionist events, and horror and science-fiction film festivals.

properties.name: Schoharie Scary Horror Film Festival
properties.description: Posted by MarclougeeSchoharie, New York"SSHFF is well on its way to becoming upstate New York’s premier genre festival dedicated to showcasing new horror shorts and features from the most audacious DIY filmmakers in the world today. SSHFF is100% on the side of the bona fide artist, the real deal, the authentic visionaries among us who are informed solely by their own angels or demons and whose films evoke not a mishmash of regurgitated pop culture, but leaps of faith into the uncharted, random paths of personal creative imagination."

properties.name: SiliCon 2007, Oct. 5-7, San Jose, CA
properties.description: Posted by MarclougeeSan Jose, CANEW UPDATES! We have some new events added; Kei/Lolita Fashion Show, Machinima Festival, Midnight Movie Massacre Hosted by Horror Yearbook.com. New guests include; SFX Director Joe Catsro ("Terror Toons"), Writer Dan Wickline ("30 Days of Nights"), Screenwriter Todd Farmer ("Jason X" & "Clock Tower"), Manga Artist Melissa Hudson (Demented Dragon") and many more have joined SiliCon 2007! Check out our Guest page for more info. Stay tuned for more news about events, guests, and other special programming coming soon!

properties.name: Starsfest / Horrorfest, Denver, CO, April 18-20, 2008
properties.description: Posted by Marclougee Denver, COHorrorfest is part of Starfest, Denver, CO in 2008! The Pit and the Pendulum will be screening over the weekend, with Director Marc Lougee joining several panels with other indie film makers. Visit Marc in the Indie Film Room, check out the new trailer, and grab a t-shirt- (design by Rue Morgue Magazine\'s art director, Gary Pullin)! The event happens April 18-20, Marriott Denver Tech Center, Denver , CO!

properties.name: Texas Frightmare Weekend
properties.description: Posted by Marclougee1590 Lyndon B Johnson Fwy, Dallas, TXYes, it\'s true. Director George Romero will be hosting the Texas Frightmare Weekend in Dallas, Texas June 22-24, 2007, and THE PIT AND THE PENDULUM will be screening at the event. Should be alot of fun, with ton\'s of special guests attending the event, including Adrienne Barbeau (Creepshow), Jeffrey Combs (Re- Animator) and a host of other folks horror film fans will not want to miss. http://www.texasfrightmareweekend.com

properties.name: Thrillville's MONSTERAMA, Oct. 18, El Cerrito, CA
properties.description: Posted by MarclougeeLos Angeles, CAHosted by Will the Thrill and Monica, Tiki Goddess! Featuring TWO all-star monsterpieces: Boris Karloff, Frankenstein\'s Monster, Count Dracula, and the Wolf Man meet and mingle in Universal\'s famous monster free-for-all HOUSE OF FRANKENSTEIN (1944) plus Hammer\'s sexy gothic vampire classic BRIDES OF DRACULA (1960). THE PIT AND THE PENDULUM short film slate for screening! "Cinema Insomnia\'s" MISTER LOBO in person! Special musical guests, theremin lounge band PROJECT PIMENTO! www.projectpimento.com Admission: 0

properties.name: Tokyo International Film Festival
properties.description: Posted by MarclougeeTokyo, Japan The Tokyo International Film Festival (hereinafter referred to as TIFF) has been held yearly since 1985 with the official endorsement of International Federation of Film Producers Associations (FIAPF) (Note 1). This year will mark the 20th time it is being held. As one of the world’s twelve largest international film festivals (Note 2). and Japan’s only officially approved international film festival, TIFF has had a major influence on Japan’s film industry and culture. The festival is divided into several categories: the traditional “Competition", which draw worldwide notice; "Special Screenings", where highly entertaining works that have yet to be released are collected under one roof; "Winds of Asia-Middle East" that anticipates new trends in Asian culture; and "Japanese Eyes" that focuses on the new appeal of Japanese movies. The PIT AND THE PENDULUM will be screening as part of a BRAVO! & NFB of Canadian pavillion, focusing on Canadian productions funded by Bravo! and the NFB.

properties.name: Toronto After Dark Film Festival, Oct. 19-25, 2007
properties.description: Posted by MarclougeeToronto, On, CanadaToronto After Dark Film Festival is one of the world’s leading showcases of thrilling international cinema, and runs annually during the week before Halloween. Our critically acclaimed festival features new horror, sci-fi, fantasy and thrilling films from around the world, including a number of award-winners. Last year, Toronto After Dark was attended by over 4,000 enthusiastic film fans and over 60 members of press and industry. This year’s much-anticipated second annual festival expands to 50 films screening over seven nights, October 19-25, 2007.

properties.name: Trick Con Treat, October 3-5, 2008!
properties.description: Posted by Marclougee 6200 N.Robinson Drive, Oklahoma City, OKTrick Con Treat hosts The Pit and the Pendulum short film as part of their fan-run freny of frolic and fearful frivolity this October 3-5, 2008 in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma!

properties.description: Posted by Marclougee 150 John Street, Toronto , ONFeaturing a wide assortment of animation films: from classical and computer animation, to stop-motion. From million dollar budgets to no budget. From OSCAR winners to lost classics! This year features The Pit and the Pendulum, the stop motion adaptation of Egdar Allan Poe\'s classic tale, Executive Produced by Ray Harryhausen!
